sentences.sentence: Times Opinion wants to address your questions about pandemic preparedness.Three years after our lives were upturned by the Covid-19 pandemic, questions remain.
What about our leaders and policymakers?
What happens next time?Times Opinion will soon start a limited-run weekly newsletter,The Next Pandemic, exploring the most pressing ideas and debates on how to prepare for future threats.

This includes debates among experts over key questions surrounding mask mandates and school closures, ideas from Covid vaccine researchers on how to better deliver next-generation vaccines, dispatches from the front lines in Brazil on how to build social trust, lessons from the role that community played in the response to monkeypox and much more.What questions do you have about pandemic preparedness?
Leave them below and we'll find experts to answer a few in the newsletter.
You cansign up hereto receive the newsletter in your inbox.
ᅳ Alexandra Sifferlin, senior staff editor, OpinionWe'll contact you before publishing your question or personal details.The Times is committed to publishinga diversity of lettersto the editor.
We'd like to hear what you think about this or any of our articles.
And here's our email:letters@nytimes.com.Follow The New York Times Opinion section onFacebook,Twitter (@NYTopinion)andInstagram.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Jeenah Moon/Reuters FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: Times Opinion wants to address your questions about pandemic preparedness.Three years after our lives were upturned by the Covid-19 pandemic, questions remain. What have we learned? What about our leaders and policymakers? What happens next time?Times Opinion will soon start a limited-run weekly newsletter,The Next Pandemic, exploring the most pressing ideas and debates on how to prepare for future threats. This includes debates among experts over key questions surrounding mask mandates and school closures, ideas from Covid vaccine researchers on how to better deliver next-generation vaccines, dispatches from the front lines in Brazil on how to build social trust, lessons from the role that community played in the response to monkeypox and much more.What questions do you have about pandemic preparedness? Leave them below and we’ll find experts to answer a few in the newsletter. You cansign up hereto receive the newsletter in your inbox. — Alexandra Sifferlin, senior staff editor, OpinionWe’ll contact you before publishing your question or personal details.The Times is committed to publishinga diversity of lettersto the editor. We’d like to hear what you think about this or any of our articles. Here are sometips. And here’s our email:letters@nytimes.com.Follow The New York Times Opinion section onFacebook,Twitter (@NYTopinion)andInstagram.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Jeenah Moon/Reuters FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
